intro: Synaphea incurva, commonly known as the bent-stemmed synaphea, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Ptilomycetaceae. It is characterized by its prostrate or ascending growth habit and is typically found in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a leafy stem with small, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are often slightly curled. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on short stalks and release spores when mature. Synaphea incurva is a cryptogamic plant that plays a role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling in its habitat.
